docs.lead_paragraph: The Chinese hacking group suspected of stealing sensitive information about millions of current and former U.S. government employees has a different mission and organizational structure than the military hackers who have been accused of other U.S. data breaches, according to people familiar with the matter.

headline.main: U.S. Employee Data Breach Tied to Chinese Intelligence: Sources

docs.lead_paragraph: Florida legislators wrapped up a rancorous special session on Friday with passage of a $78 billion state budget, narrowly avoiding a state government shutdown at the end of the month.

headline.main: Florida Lawmakers Pass $78 Billion State Budget
headline.print_headline: Florida Lawmakers Pass $78 Billion State Budget

docs.snippet: Florida legislators wrapped up a rancorous special session on Friday with passage of a $78 billion state budget, narrowly avoiding a state government shutdown at the end of the month.

docs.lead_paragraph: Repealing President Barack Obama's signature healthcare reform law would increase the U.S. budget deficit by $353 billion over 10 years, congressional forecasters said on Friday, more than  triple the red ink compared to an estimate three years ago.

headline.main: Obamacare Repeal Would Boost U.S. Deficit, Growth: Government Forecasters
headline.print_headline: Obamacare Repeal Would Boost U.S. Deficit, Growth: Government Forecasters

docs.snippet: Repealing President Barack Obama's signature healthcare reform law would increase the U.S. budget deficit by $353 billion over 10 years, congressional forecasters said on Friday, more than  triple the red ink compared to an estimate three years ago.

docs.lead_paragraph: Repealing President Barack Obama's signature health care law would modestly increase the budget deficit, while the number of uninsured Americans would rise by more than 20 million, said a nonpartisan government study released Friday.

headline.main: Report: Higher Deficits, More Uninsured if Health Law Tossed
headline.print_headline: Report: Higher Deficits, More Uninsured if Health Law Tossed

docs.snippet: Repealing President Barack Obama's signature health care law would modestly increase the budget deficit, while the number of uninsured Americans would rise by more than 20 million, said a nonpartisan government study released Friday.

headline.main: Depressed? Try Therapy Without the Therapist

docs.abstract: Interacting with a computer program can be as effective as seeing a therapist for some forms of anxiety and depression.
docs.snippet: Interacting with a computer program can be as effective as seeing a therapist for some forms of anxiety and depression.

docs.lead_paragraph: For President Barack Obama, an encouraging vote on his trade agenda and a harrowing tragedy in South Carolina showcased the promise and peril of his presidential end game.

docs.lead_paragraph: United Auto Workers President Dennis Williams said on Thursday he wants to enter talks with the three major U.S. automakers to pool active union and nonunion workers and UAW retirees to bargain for lower healthcare costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The agency that failed to secure data on millions of federal workers is now being criticized by its own independent watchdog over a plan to modernize its aging computer networks.

docs.lead_paragraph: The House defied a White House veto threat and voted Thursday to abolish a tax on medical device makers as a group of Democrats uncharacteristically joined Republicans in moving to kill part of President Barack Obama's health care law.

headline.main: House Votes to Kill Health Care Law's Medical Device Tax
headline.print_headline: House Votes to Kill Health Care Law's Medical Device Tax

docs.snippet: The House defied a White House veto threat and voted Thursday to abolish a tax on medical device makers as a group of Democrats uncharacteristically joined Republicans in moving to kill part of President Barack Obama's health care law.
